snippet: While Republicans point to the country’s ills, President Obama is presenting a message of optimism, which some say could backfire if the economy declines.
abstract: Pres Obama, in ways large and small, has seized on a narrative of national optimism, offering a portrait of a country that, guided by him and powered by the American worker, is making a comeback; narrative is reminiscent of Pres Ronald Reagan's 1984 re-election campaign and is intended to provide a contrast with less sunny Republican presidential candidates.
lead_paragraph: While Republicans point to the country’s ills, President Obama is presenting a message of optimism, which some say could backfire if the economy declines.

headline.seo: President Offers Theme of Nation Seeing Comeback
headline.main: President Offers Theme of Nation Seeing a Comeback
